intro: Hieracium wilczekianum, commonly known as Wilczek's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow ray florets surrounded by a dense cluster of tubular disc florets. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. Hieracium wilczekianum is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
